title: What is the difference between psychoanalysis and the initiatic path for exploring the depths of the self?
first_phrase: In the previous section, the text explores the idea of subconcious mind, its contents and how it is approached by various methods like psicanalysis and initiation. In the last part, the author names Carl Jung and discusses his approach to subconcious mind. Jung and other psicanalysts view the subconcious mind as a bundle of various contents, including those that relate to superconsciousness. However, the initiation approach to subconcious mind involves neutralizing the inferior regions of subconcious mind in order to avoid distortion of super-individual and super-human consciousness. The author also distinguishes between acknowledging the "law of the earth" and reducing oneself to the irrational and unconscious part of the being.

last_phrase: In conclusion, while the hygiene of the soul in individuals disconnected from modern civilization may be important, it is crucial to differentiate between this and the order of spiritual values. The method of psychoanalysis, which solely relies on the observation of dreams and fantasies, falls short in comparison to the initiatic path for deep exploration of the self. Therefore, it is essential to choose the appropriate method to avoid confusion and achieve genuine self-discovery.
